details:
This update fixes multiple memory access violations in vim.


* [CVE-2022-0318](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-0318)
Heap-based Buffer Overflow
* [CVE-2022-0392](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-0392)
Heap-based Buffer Overflow
* [CVE-2022-0629](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-0629)
Stack-based Buffer Overflow
* [CVE-2022-0696](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-0696)
`NULL` Pointer Dereference
* [CVE-2022-1619](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-1619)
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in function `cmdline_erase_chars`. This
 vulnerabilities are capable of crashing software, modify memory, and
 possible remote execution
* [CVE-2022-1621](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-1621)
Heap buffer overflow in `vim_strncpy find_word`. This vulnerability is
 capable of crashing software, Bypass Protection Mechanism, Modify
 Memory, and possible remote execution
* [CVE-2022-1785](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-1785)
Out-of-bounds Write
* [CVE-2022-1897](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-1897)
Out-of-bounds Write
* [CVE-2022-1942](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-1942)
Heap-based Buffer Overflow
* [CVE-2022-2000](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-2000)
Out-of-bounds Write
* [CVE-2022-2129](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-2129)
Out-of-bounds Write
* [CVE-2022-3235](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-3235)
Use After Free
* [CVE-2022-3256](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-3256)
Use After Free
* [CVE-2022-3352](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-3352)
Use After Free


For Debian 10 buster, these problems have been fixed in version
2:8.1.0875-5+deb10u4.


We recommend that you upgrade your vim packages.


For the detailed security status of vim please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/vim>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
